pr_title: issues #747 and #748 - batch/transaction processing edits and error handling improvement

timeline.message:
Reduce reliance on FHIRHttpException

With these changes, we should be in a better position to remove
FHIRHttpException. Instead of setting the HTTP Status code whenever we
throw, we will set just the OperationOutcome.issue.type and map those to
the desired HTTP status codes in a single spot (currently
IssueTypeToHttpStatusMapper).

These changes should help prepare us better for both #17 (fewer spots to
add logging) and #194 (replacing thrown exceptions with returned
OperationOutcome)

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>

replies.bodyText:
actually, I broke the test on accident, by following the spec instead of the current behavior.
from https://www.hl7.org/fhir/http.html#concurrency

If the version id given in the If-Match header does not match, the server returns a 412 Precondition Failed status code instead of updating the resource.

so i think it was a bug in our current impl and I'm HOPING fixing that doesn't break our touchstone results.

issues #747 and #748 - batch/transaction processing edits

Updated bundle processing such that:
1. 'batch' requests return with 200 OK when one or more of the entries
fails (check each entry for its response status).
2. 'transaction' requests return a single OperationOutcome in case of
failure.  I normalize whatever the normal status code would be into
either 400 (client error) or 500 (server error).

I also finished removing all usage of FHIRHttpException. To do it, I had
to introduced a new extension,
`http://ibm.com/fhir/extension/not-supported-detail` to disambiguate
not-supported interactions from not-supported resource types.

Signed-off-by: Lee Surprenant <lmsurpre@us.ibm.com>
